info.name: ClientSocket
info.comment: Represents a single socket connection to a client IP address.

description.p: If a Netsocket is running in server mode then it will create a new ClientSocket object every time that a new connection is opened by a client. This is a very simple class that assists in the management of I/O between the client and server.

action.name: Read
action.comment: Read incoming data from a client socket.
action.prototype: ERR acRead(*Object, APTR Buffer, INT Length, INT *Result)

input.param: Points a buffer that will receive the data.
The total number of bytes to read from the object. This value cannot exceed the size of the Buffer.
The Read action will write this parameter with the total number of bytes read into the Buffer.

description.p: The Read() action will read incoming data from the socket and write it to the provided buffer. If the socket connection is safe, success will always be returned by this action regardless of whether or not data was available. Almost all other return codes indicate permanent failure, and the socket connection will be closed when the action returns.

result.error: Read successful (if no data was on the socket, success is still indicated).
A permanent failure has occurred and socket has been closed.

action.name: Write
action.prototype: ERR acWrite(*Object, APTR Buffer, INT Length, INT Result)

input.param: A buffer containing the data that will be written to the object.
The total number of bytes to write to the object.
This parameter with be updated with the total number of bytes written from the Buffer.

description.p: Write raw data to a client socket with this action. Write connections are buffered, so any data overflow generated in a call to this action will be buffered into a software queue. Resource limits placed on the software queue are governed by the NetSocket.MsgLimit value.

field.name: ConnectTime
field.comment: System time for the creation of this socket

field.name: Incoming
field.comment: Callback for data being received from the socket

field.name: Outgoing
field.comment: Callback for data being sent over the socket

field.name: ReadCalled
field.comment: TRUE if the Read action has been called

struct.name: NetClient
struct.comment: Simple data storage class utilised by NetSocket to represent a client machine/IP.
struct.field: Pointer to a list of connections opened by this client.
